note.p: Birth: North Tawton, Devon, England (11 or 14 September 1811)
Education: London; Edinburgh; College de France and Ecole de Medecine, Paris. MD (1838, Edinburgh)

Career: Assisted his father in practice, North Tawton; began to study the origin and transmission of typhoid fever (1839); moved to Bristol (1842); Physician, Bristol Royal Infirmary (1847); had a large practice and continued to research infectious diseases; retired due to ill health
Notes: DSB gives birth date as 14 September 1811
